newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Hackers access Singapore government's website.
newsitem.headline: Hackers access Singapore government's website.

text.p: Computer hackers broke into the government's Internet website and posted a list of the user identities of more than 100 officials from various government bodies, the Straits Times newspaper reported on Monday.
The newspaper said Singapore's government directory was hacked into on Sunday and the list of user IDs left on the government's home page for at least 12 hours.
The website has links to the home pages of various government bodies, like the Singapore Broadcasting Authority, the Attorney-General's Chambers and other ministries.
The list was removed from the website later in the day and its original contents restored.
Hacking is an offence under the country's Computer Misuse Act, carrying a fine of Singapore $2,000 and a two-year jail sentence.
Penalties are more severe for gaining unauthorised access to computer data with an intent to commit an offence such as fraud.
